db:abstract.db:para: A horizontal model mapper for XYSeries.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Model mappers enable using a data model derived from the QAbstractItemModel class as a data source for a chart. A horizontal model mapper is used to create a connection between a line, spline, or scatter series and the data model that has X and Y rows for the coordinates and holds the data points for the XYSeries as columns. A TableModel is a natural choice for the model.
Both model and series properties can be used to manipulate the data. The model mapper keeps the series and the data model in sync.

db:section.db:title: columnCount : int
db:section.db:para: The number of columns of the model that are mapped as the data for series. The default value is -1 (the number is limited by the number of columns in the model).

db:section.db:title: firstColumn : int
db:section.db:para: The column of the model that contains the data for the first point of the series. The default value is 0.

db:section.db:title: model : SomeModel
db:section.db:para: The data model that is used by the mapper. You need to implement the model and expose it to QML.

db:note.db:para: The model has to support adding and removing rows or columns and modifying the data in the cells.

db:section.db:title: series : XYSeries
db:section.db:para: The series that is used by the mapper. All the data in the series is discarded when it is set to the mapper. When a new series is specified, the old series is disconnected (but it preserves its data).

db:section.db:title: xRow : int
db:section.db:para: The row of the model that contains the x-coordinates of the data points. The default value is -1 (invalid mapping).

db:section.db:title: yRow : int
db:section.db:para: The row of the model that contains the y-coordinates of the data points.
